description: When geotechnical reports and third-party engineering review are required for building permits

when_required: Grading with 50 cubic yards or less of fill less than 1 foot deep
Other requirements per DBI Information Sheet S-05
required_contents: Soil settlement and bearing pressure information
Map showing where soil tests were done
Foundation recommendations addressing soil strength, weak soils, and earthquake safety
Test results for any added or compacted soil

third_party_engineering_review.description: Independent engineering review required for projects in hazardous areas
triggers: Located in or adjacent to Earthquake-Induced Landslide Areas (per CA Seismic Hazard Zones Map)
Additions creating 1,000+ sq ft within three years
More than 50 cubic yards of excavation/fill
Projects with substantial impact on stability of any property
third_party_engineering_review.process: DBI selects pre-vetted third-party engineer; property owner bears costs
third_party_engineering_review.selection: DBI chooses the reviewer (applicant cannot select)

structural_advisory_committee.requirement: Independent committee review with at least one public hearing before approval

expediter_note: Hillside properties, proximity to landslide zones, and large excavations are common triggers that add cost and time. Check Seismic Hazard Zones Map early.
